author: Joseph Draper, PA
title: Off-road drivers were swept away by river, says man who tried to save them | BelfastTelegraph.co.uk
text: Off-road drivers were swept away by river, says man who tried to save them A man who tried to save three men trapped in a submerged 4√ó4 vehicle said they were ‚Äúswept away‚Äù as they attempted to cross a river. Emergency services including police, ambulance and a helicopter attended a location on the River Esk near Glaisdale shortly before midday on Thursday. A 4√ó4 was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3pm and three men found inside had died, North Yorkshire Police said. Chris Ford, who lives nearby, told the PA news agency the men were part of an off-roading group when they crossed a ford on Rake Lane. The river, swollen by heavy rain, swept them away and carried them around 400 yards downstream, he said. We need your consent to load this Social Media content. We use a number of different Social Media outlets to manage extra content that can set cookies on your device and collect data about your activity. It came as Storm Gerrit caused flooding and travel chaos across the country throughout Wednesday and Thursday. Mr Ford, a firewood salesman, was called to the scene to help recover the vehicle with his tractor and found it fully submerged beneath the water, he said. He and two others used tractors to pull the 4√ó4 on to the riverbank, he said. Police said another man, who attempted to help those trapped in the car, was pulled from the river and needed medical treatment. Mr Ford told PA: ‚ÄúThere was a ford they were going over and they were swept down 400 yards. ‚ÄúThey were part of an off-road club. ‚ÄúI went down with my tractor. There was a couple of vehicles ‚Äì one parked up. ‚ÄúYou couldn‚Äôt see the (other) vehicle. It was 3ft beneath the water. ‚ÄúI helped get it out on to the riverbank with three other tractors.‚Äù Two other locals, Rosie and Andrew Dale, said they were with Mr Ford when he got the call to help. They said they saw several 4√ó4 vehicles pass their home in the direction of the ford shortly before the incident. Mrs Dale said ‚Äúnobody local‚Äù would attempt to cross the ford in the current conditions. The area is popular with 4√ó4 drivers, she said, adding: ‚ÄúIn the summer you get 10 of them at a time.‚Äù A spokesperson for North Yorkshire Police said: ‚ÄúLocalised conditions across our area are making driving hazardous. ‚ÄúRoads are particularly badly affected around the River Esk, to the north of the county, as we have seen with the tragic incident near Glaisdale. ‚ÄúThere was another incident at nearby Houlsyke at 12.49pm when a car got stuck in flood water and another at Kirby Wiske in Hambleton at 2.35pm. ‚ÄúThankfully, the occupants of both vehicles were brought to safety. ‚ÄúThe key advice is to consider whether your journey is necessary. ‚ÄúPlease avoid driving through any kind of standing or moving flood water if you possibly can.‚Äù Witnesses to the incident at Glaisdale are urged to call North Yorkshire Police on 101, option 4, quoting reference NYP-28122023-0146.

author: MarketScreener
title: Royal Bank of Canada - RBC unveils retail branch retrofit plan to help reduce carbon emissions - MarketScreener
text:
Royal Bank of Canada - RBC plans to reduce its own GHG emissions through the electrification of the branch network it controls in Canada .
While you may not see it, your local RBC bank branch is working towards being powered differently in the coming years. A multi-million-dollar plan to retrofit RBC's Canadian 1,200 branch network aims to cut 10,000 tonnes of onsite carbon emissions from its operational footprint.
Installation of an energy efficient electric Heat Pump HVAC unit at RBC Morningside and Milner Scarborough
branch. ( July 2, 2024 ) ( CNW Group /RBC) The bank will embark on a major initiative that will accelerate the retrofit of its extensive branch network in Canada , investing $35 million over three years in the first phase through the installation of energy efficient, low-carbon heating and cooling systems such as heat pumps, which will replace aging heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment. RBC will first begin to convert the 62 per cent of branches where it is responsible for HVAC, aiming to accelerate this work to be completed by 2035. The bank will continue to work on electrification with landlord partners in the remaining locations. The bulk of the retrofit program is planned to begin in Spring 2025.
Approximately 40 per cent of the bank's operational carbon emissions stem from its retail locations across Canada . By updating this essential equipment, RBC estimates total branch emissions can be reduced by 70 per cent.1
This initiative will help accelerate the operational goals outlined in the bank's Climate Report 2023 by reducing RBC's own global GHG emissions and increase sourcing of electricity from renewable sources. In 2023, the bank's ongoing shift to renewable energy sources led to a 67 per cent reduction in its emissions for global operations since 2018, RBC's baseline year. Additionally, the bank now sources 100 per cent of its total global electricity consumption from renewable sources.2
'Progress is needed to reduce emissions that come from the buildings we work in, which largely stem from their heating source,' says Jennifer Livingstone
, vice president, Enterprise Climate Strategy at RBC. 'Which is why we have made this ambitious commitment to our clients, colleagues, and other stakeholders including our investors. It is one of our largest opportunities for emissions reduction within RBC's operations.' Buildings are Canada's third-largest source of greenhouse gases, contributing about 14 per cent of total emissions annually. If the country is to meet its net zero ambitions, RBC estimates 65 million tonnes of carbon emissions must be saved from this source by 2050. Emissions per square meter have fallen in recent years. However residential buildings have made more progress than commercial since 2000, at about 25 per cent compared with 7 per cent.3
'Achieving Canada's climate targets requires the building sector to prioritize energy efficiency and eliminate its reliance on combustion for heating, cooling, and hot water service for all new and existing buildings,' said Thomas Mueller
, president and CEO of Canada Green Building Council . 'Industry commitments, such as RBC's to accelerate the electrification of their properties, is a positive first step in achieving wider decarbonization across building portfolios. Verification of performance through trusted third-party certifications is also critical in measuring and reporting on progress.'
Space heating is estimated to generate 85 per cent of carbon emissions in commercial buildings, and existing technologies are available to make meaningful reductions.4 RBC owns or through lease agreements has the responsibility for controlling 62 per cent of the HVAC units across its retail branch. The remaining 38 per cent are fully controlled by its landlords.
Jon Douglas
, Director of Global Sustainability at RBC, says the bank has embarked upon an outreach program to understand its landlords' climate targets and to 'look for ways where both parties can work together in achieving mutually desirable goals.' With 22 million square feet of real estate, most of it leased from 500 landlords, Mr. Douglas
anticipates engagement will 'help drive more climate action in the real estate sector.' He went on to say the bank is already in collaboration with a landlord of a flagship property to achieve net-zero greenhouse gas emissions at the office site by 2040.5 RBC is also a founding partner of the Climate Smart Buildings Alliance , which was established in 2023 to help reduce emissions in Canada's buildings sector. Key areas of focus for the Climate Smart Buildings Alliance include increasing the use of low and zero carbon building materials; reducing combustion in buildings and supporting a clean grid; and reducing emissions through retrofits and net-zero new builds.
1 This figure is based on a model RBC developed based on industry standard practices for calculating estimated greenhouse gas (GHG) emission reductions from various potential HVAC equipment replacement measures. Both the model and the results were confirmed by an independent third-party consultant.
2 RBC procures renewable electricity through long-term power purchase agreements (PPAs) and other sources of renewable energy certificates (RECs).
3 The $2 Trillion Transition: Canada's road to Net Zero (rbc.com)
4 The $2 Trillion Transition: Canada's road to Net Zero (rbc.com)
5 In order to achieve net-zero greenhouse gas emissions at the office site by 2040, various approaches will be required, including installing low-emissions technology and the use of renewable energy certificates.
About RBC
Royal Bank of Canada is a global financial institution with a purpose-driven, principles-led approach to delivering leading performance. Our success comes from the 98,000+ employees who leverage their imaginations and insights to bring our vision, values and strategy to life so we can help our clients thrive and communities prosper. As Canada's biggest bank and one of the largest in the world, based on market capitalization, we have a diversified business model with a focus on innovation and providing exceptional experiences to our more than 18 million clients in Canada , the U.S. and 27 other countries. Learn more at rbc.com.
We are proud to support a broad range of community initiatives through donations, community investments and employee volunteer activities. See how at rbc.com/community-social-impact.
For more information, please contact
Stephen Hewitt
, RBC Executive Communications (C) 2024 Electronic News Publishing, source ENP Newswire
Share ¬© Acquiremedia - 2024

title: Imparable en la Liga Diamante: Jasmine Camacho-Quinn supera a las medallistas de oro y plata de Par√≠s 2024 en la parada de Z√∫rich - El Nuevo D√≠a
text: La final de los 100 metros con vallas por el t√≠tulo de la temporada 2024 ser√° en B√©lgica el pr√≥ximo 14 de septiembre 5 de septiembre de 2024 - 3:53 PM La final de los 100 metros con vallas por el t√≠tulo de la temporada 2024 ser√° en B√©lgica el pr√≥ximo 14 de septiembre 5 de septiembre de 2024 - 3:53 PM La puertorrique√±a [Jasmine Camacho-Quinn](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/jasmine-camacho-quinn/) logr√≥ la victoria en los 100 metros con vallas de la parada de Z√∫rich, Suiza, en la [Liga Diamante](https://www.elnuevodia.com/topicos/liga-diamante), carrera en la que super√≥ a las medallistas de oro y de plata de los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos de Par√≠s 2024. Camacho-Quinn, bronce en Par√≠s, gan√≥ el jueves con tiempo de 12.36 segundos, tan solo un cent√©sima m√°s lenta que en la final ol√≠mpica. La boricua super√≥ a la francesa Cyrena Samba-Mayela (12.40) y a la estadounidense Masai Russell (12.47), que subieron m√°s alto que ella al podio de las Olimpiadas el mes pasado. La francesa gan√≥ la de plata en Par√≠s, y Russell es la vigente campeona ol√≠mpica con el oro. La boricua ahora enfila a la final de la Liga Diamante, que ser√° el 14 de septiembre en Bruselas, B√©lgica. Jasmine llegar√° en la primera posici√≥n de la clasificaci√≥n en la temporada, con 32 puntos, pero tendr√° que ganar tambi√©n esa carrera para conquistar el trofeo del circuito. Tobi Amusan, quien ha conquistado los √∫ltimos tres t√≠tulos de la Liga Diamante en los 100 metros con vallas, est√° fuera de contienda por lo que habr√° una nueva monarca este a√±o. Camacho-Quinn, campeona ol√≠mpica de Tokio 2020, ir√° tras su primer cetro en el importante circuito. ¬°PUERTO RICO EN LO M√ÅS ALTO! üáµüá∑üî•‚Äî Panam Sports (@PanamSports) Jasmine Camacho-Quinn se lleva el primer lugar en los 100m sobre vallas con un tiempo de 12.36 en la Diamond League Z√∫rich. üèÖ ¬°Orgullo boricua! üëè [#PanamSports] [#Diamondleague] [#Puertorico] [#Atletismo] [pic.twitter.com/wWm3qZMuZU] [September 5, 2024] La corredora boricua, pasada coabanderada de la delegaci√≥n en Par√≠s 2024, lleg√≥ a la prueba de Z√∫rich este jueves como l√≠der en la Liga Diamante con 24 puntos, pero sum√≥ ocho con su triunfo en Z√∫rich y ahora totaliza 32. Le siguen Russell, con 26 puntos, la jamaiquina Danielle Williams, con 24, y Samba-Mayela con 23. A la final adelantaron las mejores ocho por puntos en el standing. Junto con las cuatro mencionadas, tambi√©n correr√°n la final de Bruselas, Ackera Nugent (Jamaica, 22 puntos); Grace Stark (Estados Unidos, 19); Nadine Visser (Pa√≠ses Bajos, 17); y Ditaji Kambundji (Suiza, 16). Camacho-Quinn no particip√≥ en las √∫ltimas dos carreras de la gira. El 25 de agosto en Polonia tuvo dolencias en una pantorilla y en un tend√≥n de Aquiles que la hicieron retirarse el mismo d√≠a de la carrera. Desde entonces descart√≥ la que competencia que se celebrar√≠a cinco d√≠as despu√©s en Roma, Italia. Antes de la prueba de este jueves, Jasmine gan√≥ e igual√≥ su mejor tiempo de 2024 en el evento Athletissima, el 22 de agosto en Suiza, donde volvi√≥ a cronometrar 12.35 segundos despu√©s de correr para ese mismo crono en la final de los 100 con vallas de los Juegos Ol√≠mpicos, para colgarse al cuello la presea de bronce. Jasmine se convirti√≥ as√≠ en la primera atleta de una delegaci√≥n puertorrique√±a en conquistar medallas en dos Olimpiadas, indistintamente de su g√©nero. Ambas han sido consecutivas, y la atleta aspira a competir cuando menos en unos Juegos de Verano adicionales en Los √Ångeles 2028. Adem√°s de su victoria de agosto en el Athletissima en Suiza, tambi√©n gan√≥ este a√±o en dos paradas de la Liga Diamante en China, ambas en abril al principio de la campa√±a. Aparte de sus dos preseas ol√≠mpicas, Jasmine tiene una medalla de plata y una de bronce en Campeonatos Mundiales de Atletismo. En este art√≠culo colabor√≥ Sara Del Valle Hern√°ndez üëë‚Äî World Athletics (@WorldAthletics) [@JCamachoQuinn]on top in Zurich. The Puerto Ricanüáµüá∑ wins the women's 100m hurdles in 12.36, beating Olympic champion [@masai_russell]. [pic.twitter.com/JVeJ31W3H1] [September 5, 2024] Las noticias explicadas de forma sencilla y directa para entender lo m√°s importante del d√≠a. author: Simon Sharwood
title: That hardware will be more reliable if you stop stabbing it all day
text: Knives and lasers don't mix ‚Ä¶ until they do On Call By the end of the working week, many a tech support worker feels like bashing the hardware with which they work. Which is why The Register each Friday offers a less aggressive outlet for any workplace frustrations that have accumulated, in the form of a fresh instalment of On Call ‚Äì the reader-contributed column in which you share tech support tales. This week, meet a reader we'll Regomize as "Lionel" who told us he once worked on the help desk for one of the world's largest retailers. "We had just rolled out Laser Radio Terminals to several thousand stores," Lionel told On Call, before kindly describing the terminals as "an early wireless handheld that looked like a laser gun with a screen." The devices included a laser barcode scanner that store employees would use to scan incoming stock so it could be registered in point-of-sale systems. The rollout did not go well. "Despite lots of testing we kept getting calls about the LCD screen failing after as little as a week of use," Lionel told On Call. A new round of testing the devices in the mega-retailer's labs could not reproduce the problem, so Lionel was sent to a store to observe how the terminals were being used in the field. "When I arrived, the store manager escorted me back to the receiving area, complaining the entire way about the 'garbage' we were making them use, and how the old paper-based system was so much better." Lionel endured that complaint and settled in to watch the staff wield the terminals. Tech support world record? 8.5 seconds from seeing to fixing Hide the keyboard ‚Äì it's the only way to keep this software running Yes, your network is down ‚Äì you annoyed us so much we crashed it Techie took five minutes to fix problem Adobe and Microsoft couldn't solve in two weeks The problem quickly became apparent. "In those days, you had to open a case of items and scan each of the items inside, and the store staff did this with a box cutter." To speed that process, store staff had taped a box cutter to the reader device ‚Äì so they could open and scan with one hand and one tool. "This involved slamming the LRT with the attached box cutter into thousands of boxes a day, which inevitably damaged the LCD screens," Lionel discovered. He also discovered that 300 other stores in the mega-chain had independently devised the same "solution." And those stores were all ones that had complained about the laser terminal's lousy reliability. Lionel wanted to tell store workers that knives and lasers don't mix. "I'd like to say we just told everyone to stop taping knives to laser terminals and the problem went away, but that didn't work," he told On Call. "We ended up actually redesigning the LRTs to handle this type of use." What's the weirdest hardware modification you've seen ‚Äì or made to keep users happy? [Click here using whatever tool you feel is appropriate](mailto:oncall@theregister.com) to send On Call an email that tells your tale and we may feature it on a future Friday. ¬Æ

author: Elizabeth Wolfe, Robert Shackelford and Cindy Von Quednow, CNN
title: Massive California waves injure some onlookers and bring flooding, treacherous beach conditions up the West coast
text: Massive California waves injure some onlookers and bring flooding, treacherous beach conditions up the West coast A powerful offshore storm is driving towering waves into the California coastline, triggering flooding and warnings of dangerous and damaging swells after several people were injured by a wave along Ventura beach on Thursday. Video above: Large Santa Cruz waves toss kids The wave crashed over a barrier along the southern California beach, tossing a wall of fast-moving water at a group of onlookers who rushed to escape the deluge, witness video shows. Seawater quickly knocked some people off their feet and pummeled cars as drivers tried to speed away. Nearly 20 people were briefly swept away in the incident and eight people were taken to the hospital, Ventura officials said. High water and dangerous rip currents will churn along some of California‚Äôs beaches through the weekend as much of the West coast ‚Äì spanning from the U.S.-Mexico border to southern Oregon ‚Äì is under coastal flood and high-surf alerts, the National Weather Service said. Waves as high as telephone poles ‚Äì about 40 feet ‚Äì could slam into San Francisco through Friday morning. Fifteen to 20-foot waves are expected along the central coast. The dangerous conditions pose an ‚Äúexceptional risk‚Äù of ocean drowning and damage to structures like piers and jetties, the National Weather Service said. The spectacular waters have enthralled some surfers and onlookers, but weather officials are cautioning that the waves and strong rip tides can be perilous for those nearby. ‚ÄúLarge breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore,‚Äù the National Weather Service warned. At least one fisherman fell overboard in a harbor off Oxnard and later came ashore uninjured, the Ventura County Fire Department said. The conditions have already caused some road closures and evacuations in coastal California communities and prompted the rescue of five campers along the San Luis Obispo coast. Crews in Ventura worked through the night to reinforce a mile-long sand barrier that was damaged by powerful waters on Thursday, the local fire department said. Standing about seven feet tall, the raised wall helps protect beachside communities. Hoping to discourage spectators, local officials closed a main access point to Ventura Pier, which saw a swell of about 20 feet on Thursday. Some coastal streets in the area have also been closed as a precaution. In central California‚Äôs Santa Cruz, the sheriff‚Äôs office [issued ](https://www.facebook.com/SantaCruzSheriffsOffice/)an evacuation warning for some areas on Thursday, sister station [KSBW](https://www.ksbw.com/article/santa-cruz-flooding-and-evacuations/46243230) reported. The warnings were lifted later in the day. The most extreme impacts were expected along the central and Ventura County coasts, along with Hermosa, Manhattan and Palos Verdes beaches, the weather service in Los Angeles said Thursday. Tempestuous waters are also battering Northern California, where the Bay Area could see waves of 28 to 33 feet, the weather service advised. A high wind alert is also in effect for the Bay Area on Friday as wind gusts of up to 50 mph are expected. Rainfall is likely to stretch northward from the Bay Area throughout the day Friday before shifting south into the weekend. Massive waves attract surfers to Mavericks Despite safety warnings, the massive waves are a welcome sight to surfers hungry to tackle the legendary swells at Mavericks Beach, about 25 miles south of San Francisco. Pro surfers and spectators flocked to the beach on Thursday for a competition at the site known for having [some of the biggest waves](https://www.visithalfmoonbay.org/articles/mavericks-biggest-surf-west-coast) in the world, CNN affiliate KGO reported. Local resident Ion Banner [told the affiliate](https://abc7news.com/mavericks-surf-ca-storm-waves-at-today-weather-half-moon-bay/14235785/) that surfers from Brazil, Tahiti and Hawaii were out in the water. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs pretty gnarly, it‚Äôs super big,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThe waves looked absolutely massive and it was everything that we expected,‚Äù said Miguel Blanco, who told KGO he flew in from Portugal to surf the waves. ‚ÄúIt was really big, I‚Äôd say 40-60 foot waves.‚Äù Mavericks‚Äô jaw-dropping waves ‚Äì caused by unique underwater rock formations ‚Äì reach their biggest heights in the winter, when big wave surfers from all over the world make pilgrimages to face the swells. The legendary waves and the surfers who brave them have been the subject of several films and documentaries, including the 2012 biopic ‚ÄúChasing Mavericks‚Äù about American surfer Jay Moriarity‚Äôs journey to surf Mavericks as a teen. On Thursday, the conditions were prime for surfers like Blanco. ‚ÄúIf it‚Äôs your turn, you just gotta go,‚Äù Blanco said. ‚ÄúWhen you see a big wave, you‚Äôre kinda scared but at the same time you‚Äôre feeling like you should go and you just go and enjoy the ride.‚Äù CNN‚Äôs David Williams contributed to this report.

author: Christian V√°zquez
title: Leagues Cup 2024: Formato, grupos y c√≥mo ver los partidos entre Liga MX y MLS
text:
Lo que necesitas saber:
El Inter de Miami con Lionel Messi se coron√≥ como el primer campe√≥n de la Leagues Cup. El formato se mantiene igual que la primera edici√≥n
Por si la edici√≥n del 2023 no fue suficiente, ya est√° casi todo listo para la Leagues Cup 2024. Hablemos del formato, grupos y el calendario de partidos del torneo que enfrenta a la Liga MX y a la MLS.
Te adelantamos que en la Fase de Grupos tendremos muy buenos partidos. El Inter Miami de Lionel Messi se enfrentar√° a los Tigres, por poner un ejemplo. Chivas jugar√° contra LA Galaxy, ex equipo del Chicharito Hern√°ndez, y contra San Jos√© Earthquakes, ex equipo de
Cade Cowell. ¬°Reencuentros!
Formato y reglas de la Leagues Cup 2024
Participar√°n en total 47 clubes: los 18 de la Liga MX y 29 de la MLS (incluyendo a los equipos de Canad√° que juegan en dicha liga).
Se dividir√°n en 15 grupos de 3 equipos; ocho grupos ser√°n Zona Oeste, mientras que los siete restantes ser√°n Zona Este. En el caso de los campeones de cada pa√≠s (
Am√©rica de la Liga MX y Columbus Crew de la MLS) no jugar√°n la Fase de Grupos‚Ä¶ debutar√°n hasta los dieciseisavos.
Cada grupo tendr√° m√≠nimo un equipo de la MLS y uno de la Liga MX. Los dos mejores de cada grupo avanzar√°n a Dieciseisavos de final y se unir√°n a los campeones. A partir de ah√≠, eliminaci√≥n directa para que lleguen 16 equipos a octavos, 8 a cuartos, 4 a semifinales y dos a la gran final de la Leagues Cup.
Cada equipo jugar√° dos partidos contra sus rivales de grupo y avanzar√°n a la siguiente ronda los dos mejores. Quien gane un partido en 90 minutos recibir√° 3 puntos; en caso de empate, cada equipo obtendr√° un punto, pero se jugar√°n penales y el ganador recibir√° un punto adicional.
As√≠ ser√° el m√©todo de clasificaci√≥n en la Leagues 2024:
- Si se gana en tiempo regular: 3 puntos
- Si se gana en penales: 2 puntos
- Si pierde en penales: 1 punto
- Si pierde en tiempo regular: 0 puntos
Los 15 grupos de la Leagues Cup 2024
En la edici√≥n del 2023, los equipos mexicanos
la sufrieron gacho entre idas y vueltas por todo Estados Unidos, por eso es que para el 2024, el Am√©rica y los clubes mejores posicionados en la tabla general jugar√°n en estadios determinados en calidad de local.
Los Rayados lo har√°n hasta los cuartos de final, Chivas hasta los dieciseisavos y Tigres solo en la Fase de Grupos, el resto tendr√° que mentalizarse a pasar varias horas abordo de un avi√≥n.
Estos son los grupos de la Leagues Cup 2024:
- Oeste 1: Monterrey, Pumas y Austin.
- Oeste 2: Chivas, LA Galaxy y San Jose Earthquakes.
- Oeste 3: St. Louis City, Dallas y Ju√°rez.
- Oeste 4: Toluca, Kansas City, Chicago Fire.
- Oeste 5: Le√≥n, Portland y Colorado.
- Oeste 6: Seattle Sounders, Minnesota y Necaxa.
- Oeste 7: LAFC, Vancouver y White Caps.
- Oeste 8: Houston Dynamo, Real Salt Lake y Atlas.
- Este 1: Cincinnati, New York y Quer√©taro.
- Este 2: Orlando, San Luis y Montreal.
- Este 3: Tigres, Puebla e Inter de Miami.
- Este 4: Philadelphia, Charlotte, Cruz Azul.
- Este 5: New England, Nashville y Mazatl√°n.
- Este 6: Pachuca, RB New York y Toronto FC.
- Este 7: Atlanta, Santos y DC United.
Calendario de partidos de la Leagues Cup 2024
La Leagues Cup 2024 dar√° inicio el 26 de julio y tendremos futbol durante todo un mes, pues termina el 25 de agosto. Algo as√≠ como un mundial, pero sin tanta calidad, porque ya sabemos como se las gastan los jugadores de la MLS y la Liga MX.
El partido inaugural de la Leagues Cup 2024 ser√° entre Atlanta United y DC United el viernes 26 de julio. El primer partido entre un equipo de la Liga MX y la MLS ser√° el Pumas vs Austin FC el mismo d√≠a.
Las fechas clave del calendario de la Leagues Cup 2024:
- Fase de grupos: 26 de julio ‚Äì 6 de agosto
- Dieciseisavos de Final: 7 ‚Äì 9 de agosto
- Octavos de final: 12 ‚Äì 13 de agosto
- Cuartos de final: 16 ‚Äì 17 de agosto
- Semifinales: 20 o 21 de agosto
- Partido por el tercer lugar: 25 de agosto
- Gran Final: 25 de agosto
La agenda de partidos de los equipos de la Liga MX en la Leagues Cup 2024:
- Pumas vs Austin FC | 26 de julio 19:00 hrs | Q2 Stadium
- LAFC vs Tijuana | 26 de julio 20:00 hrs | BMO Stadium
- Houston vs Atlas | 27 de julio 17:00 hrs | Shell Energy Stadium
- New England vs Mazatl√°n | 27 de julio 18:00 hrs | Gillette Stadium
- Puebla vs Inter Miami | 27 de julio 20:00 hrs | Fort Lauderdale
- Chivas vs San Jos√© | 27 de julio 20:00 hrs | Levi‚Äôs Stadium
- New York City vs Quer√©taro | 28 de julio 18:00 hrs | Yankee Stadium
- Le√≥n vs Portland | 28 de julio 19:30 hrs | Providence Park
- Monterrey vs Austin FC | 30 de julio 19:00 hrs | Q2 Stadium
- Pachuca vs New York Red Bull | 30 de julio 20:00 hrs | Red Bull Arena
- Minnesota vs Necaxa | 30 de julio 20:00 hrs | Allianz Field
- Charlotte vs Cruz Azul | 31 de julio 18:00 hrs | Bank of America Stadium
- Santos vs DC United | 31 de julio 21:00 hrs | Audi Field
- Dallas FC vs Ju√°rez | 31 de julio 21:00 hrs | Toyota Stadium
- Nashville vs Mazatl√°n | 31 de julio 19:00 hrs | GEODIS Park
- Tigres vs Puebla | 31 de julio 20:30 hrs | Shell Energy Stadium
- Cincinnati vs Quer√©taro | 1 de agosto 18:00 hrs | TQL Stadium
- Real Salt Lake vs Atlas | 1 de agosto 18:00 hrs | America First Field
- Toluca vs Chicago | 1 de agosto 19:00 hrs | SeatGeek Stadium
- Tigres vs Inter Miami | 3 de agosto 18:00 hrs | NRG Stadium
- Monterrey vs Pumas | 3 de agosto 20:00 hrs | Q2 Stadium
- Vancouver vs Tijuana | 3 de agosto 19:00 hrs | BC Place
- Atlanta vs Santos | 4 de agosto 17:00 hrs | Mercedes-Benz Stadium

Cabe resaltar que la Leagues Cup anuncia en un
comunicado que el premio por ganar el torneo es un boleto a la Copa de Campeones de la Concacaf 2025. De hecho, el campe√≥n, subcampe√≥n y tercer lugar calificar√°n a la pr√≥xima Concachampions.
¬øC√≥mo y d√≥nde ver los partidos de la Leagues Cup 2024?
Para ver en vivo los partidos de la Leagues 2023, la opci√≥n ser√° el MLS Season Pass de Apple TV. Ah√≠ tendr√°n gratis y en vivo todos los partidos del torneo, incluido el debut del Chicharito Hern√°ndez con Chivas en la Leagues Cup.
Adem√°s, Azteca Deportes y TUDN tendr√°n algunos juegos seleccionados en diferentes fechas.

author: Jeff Bell
title: December was warmest on record for Victoria, other Island communities
text: Yes, December in Victoria was as warm as it seemed, with the highest-ever temperature totals for the month measured at Gonzales weather station. Victoria‚Äôs mean temperature at Gonzales for December was 7.7 C, well above the normal mean temperature of 5.2 C. Temperature and precipitation have been recorded at Gonzales since 1874. Environment Canada meteorologist Lisa Erven called the ‚Äútemperature anomaly‚Äù of 2.5 degrees fairly substantial, noting much of B.C. saw above-normal temperatures for the month. ‚ÄúMany locations were within their top five and some locations hit their warmest December on record.‚Äù Joining Victoria in that group were Comox, Campbell River, Vancouver and Abbotsford. Comox had a mean temperature of 6.5 C in December, up from the normal of 3.5 C, and Campbell River‚Äôs mean temperature was 5 C ‚Äî above the typical 2.1 C. As for precipitation, Erven said there was ‚Äúa bit of a split weather pattern‚Äù for the Island in December, with Victoria at Gonzales receiving 84 per cent of the normal total and Victoria International Airport receiving 87 per cent, while Comox had 138 per cent and Campbell River 120 per cent. Precipitation on the north Island was boosted by some heavy rainfall late in the month, Erven said. Part of the reason for December‚Äôs relative warmth is that many of the month‚Äôs weather systems approached from the southwest, she said. ‚ÄúWhen that happens, they typically bring up more mild air from southerly origins,‚Äù Erven said. ‚ÄúAs our weather systems made their way through the province, they were bringing that mild air with them.‚Äù That meant precipitation largely fell as rain at low elevations, and even at middle and upper levels at times, she said. Erven said temperatures should begin to drop to more normal levels once the weekend arrives. ‚ÄúBasically we‚Äôre going to finish out this week in an active weather pattern, so that means periods of rain and mild temperatures,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut then as we get into the weekend, the cold front goes through and we will be looking at temperatures that are way more seasonal for this time in January.‚Äù The result for Victoria should be daytime highs in the low to middle single digits and overnight lows approaching zero, with any chance of snow at low elevations most likely to come toward the end of next week. Farther up the Island, there is a possibility of snow at higher elevations ‚Äî perhaps including Mount Washington ‚Äî at the beginning of next week, Erven said. She said that the Malahat doesn‚Äôt appear to be due for snow any time soon, but those travelling on Highway 4 between Port Alberni and Tofino and Ucluelet should be prepared for the potential for snow Sunday into Monday. jbell@timescolonist.com >>> To comment on this article, write a letter to the editor: letters@timescolonist.com

author: Rosario3
title: Paro en farmacias: presentan un amparo contra el DNU de Milei y cierran los negocios al mediod√≠a
text: La Confederaci√≥n Farmac√©utica Argentina (Cofa) anticip√≥ que este viernes presentar√° un recurso de amparo ante la justicia para frenar la implementaci√≥n del Decreto de necesidad y urgencia (DNU) 70/2023 del gobierno de Javier Milei y realizar√° un cese de actividades entre las 12 y las 13. La medida es nacional y seg√∫n confirm√≥ a Rosario3 Fanny del Rosario Ronchi, presidenta del C√≠rculo de Prestaciones Farmace√∫ticas, las oficinas de farmacia de la ciudad adhieren. La Cofa considera que los cambios por decreto que impuso Milei a la actividad, es decir sin debate ni consenso, ‚Äúlleva a la destrucci√≥n a la profesi√≥n farmac√©utica‚Äù y ‚Äúpone en extrema vulnerabilidad la salud de los argentinos‚Äù. La presentaci√≥n, seg√∫n precis√≥ el presidente de la entidad, Ricardo Pesenti, ser√° acompa√±ada por una concentraci√≥n frente al Palacio de Tribunales, en el centro porte√±o, en tanto las farmacias cerrar√°n sus persianas durante una hora, a partir del mediod√≠a. El C√≠rculo de Farmac√©uticos de Rosario expres√≥ adem√°s que se suma a la "defensa de la profesi√≥n farmac√©utica y de los estudiantes de farmacia". "Tambi√©n defendemos el modelo de la Confederaci√≥n Farmac√©utica Argentina del cual somos parte, la importancia del farmac√©utico en todos los √°mbitos, como actor fundamental del sistema de salud", a√±adi√≥ Ronchi. "Y en el caso de las oficinas de farmacias defendemos el modelo europeo, dando atenci√≥n farmac√©utica en cada dispensa", agreg√≥ la dirigente local y cont√≥ que una delegaci√≥n del c√≠rculo viajar√° a Buenos Aires para acompa√±ar el reclamo. Los motivos La Confederaci√≥n Argentina aclar√≥ que ‚Äúesta no es una medida pol√≠tica; de hecho, muchos farmac√©uticos votaron a este gobierno, sin embargo, creemos que hay desconocimiento de las consecuencias graves que trae este DNU‚Äù. ‚ÄúCon el argumento falso de bajar el precio de los medicamentos, el DNU lleva a la destrucci√≥n de la profesi√≥n farmac√©utica, minando 20 art√≠culos de la Ley 17.565 de ejercicio profesional‚Äù, sostuvo la Confederaci√≥n Farmac√©utica en un comunicado. El DNU 70/2023, mediante la modificaci√≥n de la ley 17.565, elimina la exigencia de que "los medicamentos denominados de venta libre y de especialidades farmac√©uticas, cualquiera sea su condici√≥n de expendio, s√≥lo podr√°n ser efectuadas en todo el territorio de la Naci√≥n, en farmacias habilitadas". Tambi√©n deja afuera el texto que especificaba que "los medicamentos denominados de venta libre deber√°n ser dispensados personalmente en mostrador por farmac√©uticos o personas autorizadas para el expendio", indic√≥ la COFA. A su vez, la medida dictada por el Gobierno deja sin efecto lo que establec√≠a la ley, que determinaba que "la venta y despacho fuera de estos establecimientos se considera ejercicio ilegal de la farmacia y, sin perjuicio de las sanciones establecidas por la ley, los que la efect√∫en podr√°n ser denunciados por infracci√≥n al C√≥digo Penal". ‚ÄúTambi√©n lleva al fin de las farmacias que est√°n en los barrios m√°s alejados, en los pueblos, beneficiando a las cadenas que se concentran en los grandes centros urbanos‚Äù, detall√≥ COFA. Adem√°s, advirti√≥ que, con estas medidas, ‚Äúlos medicamentos no van a bajar de precio, porque el precio lo fijan los laboratorios, no las farmacias‚Äù, pero ‚Äúlo que s√≠ va a suceder es que se pone en extrema vulnerabilidad la salud de los argentinos quitando controles sanitarios sobre los medicamentos‚Äù. ‚ÄúSi hay desv√≠os en la calidad, problemas de fabricaci√≥n, adulteraci√≥n o falsificaci√≥n, no va a haber forma de detectarlo oportunamente ni de retirar esos productos del mercado‚Äù, destac√≥. ‚ÄúLos farmac√©uticos somos imprescindibles, sobre todo hoy, en un contexto de crisis del sistema sanitario, cada vez con mayor demanda de atenci√≥n. Brindamos servicios fundamentales como el control de la presi√≥n, aplicaci√≥n de vacunas, de inyectables, curaciones, manejo de la medicaci√≥n‚Äù, concluy√≥ Cofa.

author: VNExplorer
title: Una coste√±a y una cale√±a, las militares con nervios de acero del Ej√©rcito que enfrentan a los criminales desde el aire
text:
Las dos militares hacen parte de la tripulaci√≥n de un helic√≥ptero de guerra Black Hawk. La cabo Karen Portilla, (con las balas en la mano), es la √∫nica mujer artillera y la teniente Andrea Torres, es la piloto m√°s joven.
Con el pulso firme, pero a la vez guardando los toques femeninos, as√≠ son la teniente Andrea Torres y la cabo Karen Portilla. Estas valientes mujeres forman parte de la tripulaci√≥n de un helic√≥ptero de guerra del Ej√©rcito; la teniente es la piloto y la cabo es la artillera, es decir, quien maneja la potente ametralladora que sirve para proteger la aeronave de cualquier ataque o para defender a las tropas.
Las dos militares caminan con propiedad por la base de Tolemaida, donde se encuentra la mayor parte de la flota de helic√≥pteros Black Hawk del Ej√©rcito. Ni los cerca de 30 grados de temperatura parecen incomodarlas.
Luego de recibir las √≥rdenes de sus superiores sobre la misi√≥n secreta que tienen que desarrollar, Torres y Portilla salen de la sala estrat√©gica con rumbo al hangar donde se encuentra el Black Hawk que comandar√°n. Entre las dos, le quitan el ropaje que cubre la aeronave y que la protege de la ferocidad del clima cundinamarqu√©s.
Las dos mujeres saben que de esa aeronave no solamente depende la vida de ellas, sino de otros uniformados a quienes tienen que ir a apoyar. Ambas siguen los protocolos establecidos antes de cada vuelo. Torres inspecciona los controles de la cabina y Portilla la ametralladora que va empotrada en el helic√≥ptero, las dos saben que no hay espacio para errores, porque el m√°s m√≠nimo descuido puede terminar en tragedia.
‚ÄúA quien primero me encomiendo es a Dios y luego a mi pap√° que est√° en el cielo y es por quien yo estoy en el Ej√©rcito. En un sue√±o √©l me dijo que me fuera para el Ej√©rcito y ac√° estoy‚Äù, dice la teniente Torres, mientras revisa la aeronave antes de encender motores.
Esta mujer, oriunda de Barranquilla, asegur√≥ que de los momentos m√°s fuertes que le ha tocado vivir como piloto de combate son las misiones cuando tienen que ir a brindar apoyo para rescatar a las tropas donde hay uniformados heridos.
‚ÄúTristemente, lo que lo marca a uno muchas veces, y no es de alegr√≠a, son esas misiones en las que tenemos que ir a hacer rescate de personal herido, personal que necesita reacci√≥n inmediata, apoyo de nosotros. Al sacarlos y extraerlos se les ve las caras de angustia, de dolor, de sufrimiento, esos son los momentos m√°s duros‚Äù, relat√≥.
Pero ah√≠ no paran los momentos dif√≠ciles. Tambi√©n cont√≥ que cuando se accidentan helic√≥pteros son momentos muy duros para ella, como ocurri√≥ en un caso en que falleci√≥ una amiga cercana, que era la primera mujer piloto en volar un UH1N, quien se accident√≥ en Quibd√≥, Choc√≥, un siniestro registrado en varios videos aficionados que mostraron c√≥mo el helic√≥ptero perdi√≥ el control en el aire y comenz√≥ a girar hasta chocar contra el piso.
‚ÄúQuiero hacerle un homenaje a mi teniente Garc√≠a, esa fue la primera vez que supe lo que se siente ver caer a un ser querido en una misi√≥n. La menciono a ella porque s√© que desde el cielo nos ilumina y nos gu√≠a. Desde los inicios tuvimos buenos lazos y verla caer ese d√≠a fue muy duro, eso no se puede explicar, afectan mucho esos hechos‚Äù, manifest√≥ la teniente.
La primera militar artillera Del otro lado del ala del helic√≥ptero, se encuentra la cabo Karen Portilla revisando las municiones, la ametralladora, que dispara entre 650 y 950 proyectiles por minuto, y la estructura donde ir√° anclada la poderosa arma. Esta cale√±a, de 27 a√±os de edad, dice sentirse muy orgullosa de ocupar una posici√≥n que antes solo desempe√±aban militares hombres.
‚ÄúEs una experiencia muy gratificante para nosotras las mujeres porque es una oportunidad que se nos est√° dando para demostrar que las mujeres somos valientes, guerreras, aguerridas y demostrar que nada nos queda grande. En este caso, las armas son pesadas, pero como vamos en vuelo no es necesario llevarlas cargadas, van en un soporte y se facilita poderlas cargar y manipularlas, y en el campo de acci√≥n recibimos constantes entrenamientos‚Äù, explic√≥ la cabo Portilla.
‚ÄúCuando salimos a vuelo experimentamos un vac√≠o, pero a la vez me siento una mujer poderosa, una mujer fuerte, una mujer que ha superado sus propios l√≠mites y a la vez muy orgullosa de estar realizando esta labor. Soy la primera mujer tripulante del equipo UH60 Black Hawk. Para m√≠ es un orgullo estar representando a las mujeres en esta valerosa misi√≥n‚Äù, a√±adi√≥.
Torres y Portilla aseguraron que volar las dos juntas es un sue√±o hecho realidad y esperan que a futuro toda una tripulaci√≥n sea compuesta por solo mujeres. ‚ÄúSe siente respaldo, que as√≠ como somos las √∫nicas, que ella por la parte de ser piloto y yo por la parte de ser artillera nos estamos apoyando mutuamente en representaci√≥n del papel de la mujer en esas m√°quinas tan importantes‚Äù, dijo la cabo Portilla.
‚ÄúLos hombres se asombran cuando se dan cuenta de que somos mujeres, se sienten extra√±ados, pero lo reciben muy bien y hasta nos preguntan c√≥mo fue el proceso, y esperamos que llegue el momento donde toda la tripulaci√≥n sea conformada por solo mujeres‚Äù, se√±al√≥ a su turno la teniente Torres.
En la actualidad, el Ej√©rcito tiene 14 mujeres pilotos y solamente una mujer artillera.
